result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Deonta Maleak Span

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Deonta Maleak Span appeared by video.  Attorney Sylvan Jaspen appeared by video for Deonta Maleak Span.  Attorney John J Rejowski appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

HELD OFF THE RECORD VIA ZOOM. BRANCH 46 IS IN JURY TRIAL ON ANOTHER MATTER AND NOT AVAILABLE FOR TODAY'S HEARING. 
Case in Court for Scheduling Conference with Co-Defendant Case, 22CF3068. Defense received discovery material; however, has NOT received an offer from the State. State advised the Court that Defendant's DPA in Branch 17 will be revoked. Case adjourned for Status hearing, Branch 46. Status hearing scheduled for December 12, 2022 at 08:45 am. Hearing will be held via Zoom Video Conference.
JusticePoint PreTrial Services Supervision Report dated October 26, 2022; received and filed.

Defendant Deonta Maleak Span in court with attorney Sylvan Jaspen.  John Rejowski appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Deonta Maleak Span appeared by video means with Attorney.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded. Court took judicial notice of case #21CF4923. Sworn for the State: MCSO Deputy T. Durand. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 46, Judge Feiss.  Scheduling conference scheduled for October 27, 2022 at 09:00 am.
JusticePoint PreTrial Services Supervision Report dated 08-10-2022; received and filed.
OSPD APPOINTMENT OF COUNSEL REPORT; received and filed.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms. Court order co defendants keep separate while in custody.

Defendant Deonta Maleak Span in court with attorney Sylvan Jaspen.  Defendant Deonta Maleak Span in custody. Michael J. Odden appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deonta Maleak Span appeared by video means with Attorney.  Due to Co-defendant case, Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Feiss, Branch 46. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.    Defense enters a plea of NOT GUILTY as to misdemeanor count 9. DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.   
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 11, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Jeremy K.Z. Jr
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
